required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Everolimus Plus Reduced Cyclosporine Versus Mycophenolic Acid Plus Cyclosporine in Kidney Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety Study Comparing Concentration-controlled Everolimus in Two Doses (1.5 and 3.0 mg/Day Starting Doses) With Reduced Cyclosporine Versus 1.44 g Mycophenolic Acid (as Sodium Salt) With Standard Dose Cyclosporine in de Novo Renal Transplant Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to compare the safety and efficacy of three immunosuppressive treatment regimens following a kidney transplant.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Composite Efficacy Endpoints - 12 Month Analysis
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint was the 12 month analysis of primary efficacy failure defined as a composite endpoint including treated biopsy proven acute rejection (BPAR), graft loss, death or loss to follow-up. A treated BPAR episode was defined as a biopsy graded IA, IB, IIA, IIB, or III that was treated with anti-rejection therapy. Graft loss was defined as the allograft was presumed to be lost on the day the patient started dialysis and was not able to subsequently be removed from dialysis as well as re-transplant.

primary_outcome.measure: Non-inferiority Analysis on Percentage of Participants With Composite Efficacy Endpoints
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint was the 12 month analysis of primary efficacy failure defined as a composite endpoint including treated biopsy proven acute rejection (BPAR), graft loss, death or loss to follow-up. In the definition of composite efficacy failure, loss to follow-up includes patients who did not experience treated BPAR, graft loss or death on or after day 1 and whose last day of contact was prior to day 316, the start day of the 12 month visit window.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With the Composite Incidence of Graft Loss, Death or Loss to Follow up at 12 Months Post-transplantation
secondary_outcome.description: Graft loss was defined as graft loss (the allograft was presumed to be lost on the day the patient started dialysis and was not able to subsequently be removed from dialysis) and re-transplant. A loss to follow-up patient in the composite endpoint of graft loss, death or loss to follow-up (the main secondary efficacy endpoint) was a patient who did not experience graft loss or death from day 1 and whose last day of contact was prior to study day 316.

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-inferiority Analysis of Renal Function, Calculated by Glomerular Filtration Rate (cGFR) Using Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Formula
secondary_outcome.description: Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula is: GFR [mL/min/1.73m^2] = 186.3*(C^-1.154)*(A^-0.203)*G*R where C is the serum concentration of creatinine [mg/dL], A is patient age at sample collection date [years], G=0.742 when gender is female, otherwise G=1, R=1.21 when race is black, otherwise R=1

arm_group.description: 1.5 mg everolimus (one 0.75-mg tablet bis in diem/twice a day (bid)) + basiliximab + reduced-dose Cyclosporine A (CsA) ± corticosteroids. The CsA dose was adjusted to attain a trough (C0) value within the pre-specified target ranges: starting at the day 5 visit: 100-200 ng/mL, starting at the month 2 visit: 75-150 ng/mL, starting at the month 4 visit: 50-100 ng/mL and starting at the month 6 visit: 25-50 ng/mL. Patients received their first dose of basiliximab within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and on day 4 post-transplant or according to local practice. Corticosteroids were administered according to local therapy.

3.0 mg everolimus (two 0.75-mg tablets bid) + basiliximab + reduced-dose CsA ± corticosteroids. The CsA dose was adjusted to attain a trough (C0) value within the pre-specified target ranges: starting at the day 5 visit: 100-200 ng/mL, starting at the month 2 visit: 75-150 ng/mL, starting at the month 4 visit: 50-100 ng/mL and starting at the month 6 visit: 25-50 ng/mL. Patients received their first dose of basiliximab within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and on day 4 post-transplant or according to local practice. Corticosteroids were administered according to local therapy.

1.44 g Mycophenolic Acid (two 360-mg tablets bid) + basiliximab + standard-dose CsA ± corticosteroids. The CsA dose was adjusted to attain a C0 value within the following range for the time of the study: starting at the day 5 visit: 200-300 ng/mL, starting at the month 2 visit and thereafter: 100-250 ng/mL. Patients received their first dose of basiliximab within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and on day 4 post-transplant or according to local practice. Corticosteroids were administered according to local therapy.

intervention.description: oral, bis in diem/twice a day (bid)
2 oral capsules of mycophenolic acid 360mg administered bid
CsA dose adjustments were based on CsA trough levels (C0).

All patients received two 20 mg doses of basiliximab administered intravenously. The first dose was to be given within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and the second dose was to be administered on day 4, or each dose could have been administered according to local practice.
Oral corticosteroids were administered according to local practice during the trial. At the same center, all patients were to follow the same steroid administration protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients of any race between 18 to 70 years old (inclusive)
- Patients who gave written informed consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recipients of multi-organ transplantation
- Recipients of a primary cadaveric or primary non-human leucocyte antigen (HLA) identical living donor kidney transplantation.
- Graft cold ischemia time greater than 40 hours.
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

clinical_study.keyword: Renal transplantation, kidney, and organ transplant

group.title: Low-dose Everolimus Group
group.description: 1.5 mg everolimus (one 0.75-mg tablet bis in diem/twice a day (bid)) + basiliximab + reduced-dose Cyclosporine A (CsA) ± corticosteroids. The CsA dose was adjusted to attain a trough (C0) value within the pre-specified target ranges: starting at the day 5 visit: 100-200 ng/mL, starting at the month 2 visit: 75-150 ng/mL, starting at the month 4 visit: 50-100 ng/mL and starting at the month 6 visit: 25-50 ng/mL. Patients received their first dose of basiliximab within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and on day 4 post-transplant or according to local practice. Corticosteroids were administered according to local therapy.

group.title: High-dose Everolimus Group
group.description: 3.0 mg everolimus (two 0.75-mg tablets bid) + basiliximab + reduced-dose CsA ± corticosteroids. The CsA dose was adjusted to attain a trough (C0) value within the pre-specified target ranges: starting at the day 5 visit: 100-200 ng/mL, starting at the month 2 visit: 75-150 ng/mL, starting at the month 4 visit: 50-100 ng/mL and starting at the month 6 visit: 25-50 ng/mL. Patients received their first dose of basiliximab within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and on day 4 post-transplant or according to local practice. Corticosteroids were administered according to local therapy.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: 1.44 g Mycophenolic Acid (MPA) (two 360-mg tablets bid) + basiliximab + standard-dose CsA ± corticosteroids. The CsA dose was adjusted to attain a C0 value within the following range for the time of the study: starting at the day 5 visit: 200-300 ng/mL, starting at the month 2 visit and thereafter: 100-250 ng/mL. Patients received their first dose of basiliximab within 2 hours prior to transplant surgery and on day 4 post-transplant or according to local practice. Corticosteroids were administered according to local therapy.

participants_list.participants: Under 12 month analysis under group 1, 179 Completed study medication.
Under 12 month analysis under group 2, 175 Completed study medication.
Under 12 month analysis under group 3, 200 Completed study medication.
Under 24 month analysis under group 1, 167 Completed study medication.
Under 24 month analysis under group 2, 161 Completed study medication.
Under 24 month analysis under group 3, 185 Completed study medication.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With the Composite Incidence of Graft Loss, Death or Loss to Follow up at 12 Months Post-transplantation
measure.description: Graft loss was defined as graft loss (the allograft was presumed to be lost on the day the patient started dialysis and was not able to subsequently be removed from dialysis) and re-transplant. A loss to follow-up patient in the composite endpoint of graft loss, death or loss to follow-up (the main secondary efficacy endpoint) was a patient who did not experience graft loss or death from day 1 and whose last day of contact was prior to study day 316.

analysis.groups_desc: Everolimus is non-inferior to mycophenolic acid (MPA) if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval for the difference in combined graft loss, death or loss to follow-up rates is <10%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin was set at 10%.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiple comparisons, the two-sided significance level was set at 0.025.

analysis.groups_desc: Everolimus is non-inferior to MPA if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval for the difference in combined graft loss, death or loss to follow-up rates is <10%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin was set at 10%.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiple comparisons, the two-sided significance level was set at 0.025.

outcome.title: Non-inferiority Analysis on Percentage of Participants With Composite Efficacy Endpoints
outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint was the 12 month analysis of primary efficacy failure defined as a composite endpoint including treated biopsy proven acute rejection (BPAR), graft loss, death or loss to follow-up. In the definition of composite efficacy failure, loss to follow-up includes patients who did not experience treated BPAR, graft loss or death on or after day 1 and whose last day of contact was prior to day 316, the start day of the 12 month visit window.

measure.title: Non-inferiority Analysis on Percentage of Participants With Composite Efficacy Endpoints
measure.description: The primary efficacy endpoint was the 12 month analysis of primary efficacy failure defined as a composite endpoint including treated biopsy proven acute rejection (BPAR), graft loss, death or loss to follow-up. In the definition of composite efficacy failure, loss to follow-up includes patients who did not experience treated BPAR, graft loss or death on or after day 1 and whose last day of contact was prior to day 316, the start day of the 12 month visit window.

analysis.groups_desc: Everolimus is non-inferior to mycophenolic acid (MPA) if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval for the difference in percentage of participants composite efficacy failure is <10%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin was set at 10%.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiple comparisons, the two-sided significance level was set at 0.025.

analysis.groups_desc: Everolimus is non-inferior to MPA if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval for the difference in composite efficacy failure rates is <10%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin was set at 10%.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiple comparisons, the two-sided significance level was set at 0.025.

outcome.title: Non-inferiority Analysis of Renal Function, Calculated by Glomerular Filtration Rate (cGFR) Using Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Formula
outcome.description: Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula is: GFR [mL/min/1.73m^2] = 186.3*(C^-1.154)*(A^-0.203)*G*R where C is the serum concentration of creatinine [mg/dL], A is patient age at sample collection date [years], G=0.742 when gender is female, otherwise G=1, R=1.21 when race is black, otherwise R=1

measure.title: Non-inferiority Analysis of Renal Function, Calculated by Glomerular Filtration Rate (cGFR) Using Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Formula
measure.description: Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula is: GFR [mL/min/1.73m^2] = 186.3*(C^-1.154)*(A^-0.203)*G*R where C is the serum concentration of creatinine [mg/dL], A is patient age at sample collection date [years], G=0.742 when gender is female, otherwise G=1, R=1.21 when race is black, otherwise R=1

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis: the mean GFR of the everolimus arm is lower (worse) than that of the MPA arm by 8 mL/min/1.73m^2 or more.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin was set at -8 mL/min/1.73m^2.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiple comparisons, the two-sided significance level was set at 0.025.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis: the mean GFR of the everolimus arm is lower (worse) than that of the MPA arm by 8 mL/min/1.73m^2 or more.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The non-inferiority margin was set at -8 mL/min/1.73m^2.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiple comparisons, the two-sided significance level was set at 0.025.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
